comments.html: I emailed them my idea after reading you post.  I hope there is not a situation at Cisco where someone self destructs after reading my Vogan poetry.
comments.name: Ronald Bartels

comments.html: What did you propose? Building Infinite Improbability routing offload with the Net::Tachyon library?
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
Everyone knows you can not do infinite improbability routing offload on an AXP. That can only be done on a seperate LINUX box!
I have decided on something easier and have implemented Harry Potter's magical objects on the AXP http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magical_objects_in_Harry_Potter
comments.name: Ronald Bartels
